column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Ba0.65Rb0.35Fe2As2 were prepared in evacuated quartz ampoules by a solid-state reaction method.
#Text=Fe2As, BaAs and RbAs were obtained by reacting high-purity As (99.999 %), Fe (99.9%), Ba (99.9%) and Rb (99.95%) at 800, 650 and 500 °C, respectively.
#Text=Using stoichiometric amounts of BaAs or RbAs and Fe2As, the terminal compounds BaFe2As2 and RbFe2As2 were synthesized at 950 and 650 °C, respectively.
#Text=Finally, samples of Ba1−xRbxFe2As2 with x=0.35 were prepared from appropriate amounts of single-phase BaFe2As2 and RbFe2As2.
#Text=The components were mixed, pressed into pellets, placed into alumina crucibles and annealed for 100 h under vacuum at 650 °C with one intermittent grinding.
#Text=Powder X-ray diffraction analysis revealed that the synthesized samples are single-phase materials.
